afester.javafx.tools

Class ColorSeparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • afester.javafx.tools.ColorSeparator

  • public class ColorSeparator
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class to extract red, green and blue color channels from an image.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ColorSeparator(javafx.scene.image.Image image)
      Creates a ColorSeparator and specified the input image.

    • Method Detail

      • createColorMask

        public javafx.scene.effect.ColorInput createColorMask(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Creates a color mask in the size of the source image.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to use for the mask
        Returns:
        A color mask with the given color and the size of the source image.

      • createColorBlend

        public javafx.scene.effect.Blend createColorBlend(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Create a color Blend effect for the source image.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to use for the top source area.
        Returns:
        A Blend effect of type MULTIPLY and with a top source which is a solid area of the given color.

      • getRedChannel

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getRedChannel()
        Returns:
        An image which is identical to the input image, but contains the red color channel only.

      • getGreenChannel

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getGreenChannel()
        Returns:
        An image which is identical to the input image, but contains the green color channel only.

      • getBlueChannel

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getBlueChannel()
        Returns:
        An image which is identical to the input image, but contains the blue color channel only.

      • getBlueChannel1

        public javafx.scene.image.Image getBlueChannel1()
        Deprecated. Use getBlueChannel instead
        Brain-dead implementation of a color separator which returns the blue color channel of an image.
        Returns:
        An image which is identical to the source image, but contains the blue color channel only.
